page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Lingfield is a prosperous village of between three and four thousand people. The railway has contributed to its prosperity, providing a commuter service for white_ collar workers to London, Croydon and East Grinstead. Once largely a rural area there are still 15 small farms. But now increasingly unbanished, Lingfield and Newchapel together offer some 30 shops and 80 services and light industries. Most are small businesses, each employing a handful of people. Dominating the area is Lingfield Park Racecourse with its staff of 35. Other larger employers are nationally known companies like Geest Industries (wholesale greengrocers) and Rentokil (wood preservation specialist). There is little unemployment here.
